page.title: 15ECOLOGY: WILD FLOWERS
page.content: Along the pathways and on hedgebanks we saw lots of wild flowers. We were able to identify some of them, such as, pink campion, hemlock, field buttercup, stinging nettle, cow parsley, ox-eye daisy, poppy and speedwell. In the hedgerows honeysuckle, elder, bramble, periwinkle and deadly nightshade were in flower and improved the appearance of the hedges. Down in the marshy areas beside the Medina River and the East Yar River we came across a very colourful, pretty flower called yellow flag. It grew over a wide area of marsh. For those who like nature and enjoy walks in the country the Worsley trail and Shepherds trail which cross our area are worth following. The view and wild flowers reward the keen walker.
